trans-unit.source: Provides evidence about the hash value for an assembly.
This class cannot be inherited.
A hash value represents a unique value that corresponds to a particular set of bytes.
Rather than referring to an assembly by name, version, or other designation, a hash value designates the assembly without ambiguity.
Names are subject to collisions in rare cases where the same name is given to completely different code.
Different variations of code can accidentally be marked with the same version.
However, even changing a single bit results in a very different hash value.
Hash values are a cryptographically secure way to refer to specific assemblies in policy without the use of digital signatures.
A secure hash algorithm is designed so that it is computationally infeasible to construct a different assembly with the identical hash value by either an accidental or malicious attempt.

By default, evidence from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SHA1> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.MD5> hash algorithms is supported, although any hash algorithm can be used through <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash.GenerateHash%2A>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Hash"></xref> class.
The hash value computation is not performed until one of the properties or methods is called.
The assembly for which to compute the hash value.
The assembly parameter is `null`.
assembly is not a run-time object.
Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
A new object that is a copy of this instance.
Creates a <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Hash"></xref> object that contains an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.MD5"></xref> hash value.
The returned <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash> object contains only the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash.MD5%2A> property.
A byte array that contains an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.MD5"></xref> hash value.
An object that contains the hash value provided by the md5 parameter.
The md5 parameter is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Hash"></xref> object that contains a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.SHA1"></xref> hash value.
The returned <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash> object contains only the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash.SHA1%2A> property.
A byte array that contains a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.SHA1"></xref> hash value.
An object that contains the hash value provided by the sha1 parameter.
The sha1 parameter is `null`.
Creates a <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Hash"></xref> object that contains a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.SHA256"></xref> hash value.
The returned <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash> object contains only the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash.SHA256%2A> property.
A byte array that contains a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.SHA256"></xref> hash value.
A hash object that contains the hash value provided by the sha256 parameter.
The sha256 parameter is `null`.
Computes the hash value for the assembly using the specified hash algorithm.
The assembly specified in the class constructor provides the bytes for computing the hash value.
The `hashAlg` parameter is an object derived from a specific <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm>.
The returned hash value is of the type identified by `hashAlg`.
The hash algorithm to use to compute the hash value for the assembly.
A byte array that represents the hash value for the assembly.
The hashAlg parameter is `null`.
The hash value for the assembly cannot be generated.
Gets the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with the parameter name and additional exception information.
This method is provided to support inheritance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.
Gets the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.MD5"></xref> hash value for the assembly.
The assembly specified in the class constructor provides the bytes for the hash computation.
A byte array that represents the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.MD5"></xref> hash value for the assembly.
Gets the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.SHA1"></xref> hash value for the assembly.
The assembly specified in the constructor provides the bytes for the hash computation.
A byte array that represents the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.SHA1"></xref> hash value for the assembly.
Gets the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.SHA256"></xref> hash value for the assembly.
The assembly that is specified in the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Hash.%23ctor%2A> constructor provides the bytes for the hash computation.
A byte array that represents the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.SHA256"></xref> hash value for the assembly.
Returns a string representation of the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Hash"></xref>.
This method is useful during debugging to get an easy-to-read representation of the object.
A representation of the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.Hash"></xref>.
